workflow.name: Generate personalized cold email icebreakers with GPT-4 from Google Sheets to instantly
workflow.description:
Overview:
This workflow automates the full pipeline of preparing scraped leads and loading them into an Instantly campaign for cold outreach.It begins by pulling rows from a Google Sheet that contains lead data sourced from your scraper or enrichment tools. Each row is checked for required fields first name, last name, summary, and email.

 The workflow also validates the email format to ensure only usable contacts continue through the system.

For every lead that passes the filter, the workflow uses OpenAI to clean and standardize the contact‚Äôs name and then generates a personalized icebreaker. 

Use Cases:
If your running an instantly campaign for cold email outreach this tool can gernerate personaizled ice breakers 
Prerequiste:To have instantly campaign along with instantly API
google sheet API
Also a Telegram api (optional)

Extra Info:
The icebreaker is crafted using the lead‚Äôs summary, company information, job history, achievements, or any contextual details your sheet provides. This personalization step is heavily dependent on the quality and freshness of your scraped data.

The workflow appends the lead into a selected Instantly campaign, storing the icebreaker as a custom variable so it can be inserted directly into your outreach sequence. After all leads have been processed and uploaded, the workflow sends a Telegram notification confirming completion. This gives you fast visibility and ensures you always know when a new batch has successfully synced into Instantly.

workflow.name: Extract Leads and add to instantly

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.text:
=Hello Master,
Your n8n Instantly add leads From EMAIL SCRAPE Workflow is completed.

values.content:
=Task

Create one unique, engaging sentence using the provided variables: firstName, lastName, summary, company, and jobTitle.

Specifics

Focus on one specific achievement, interest, or detail mentioned in the summary.

Tone: confident, natural, and casual ‚Äî not robotic or overly formal.

Use the company name only if it fits naturally; avoid forced mentions.

Keep the icebreaker one sentence maximum (compound is allowed, but no separate sentences).

End with a variation of:

‚Äúso I figured I‚Äôd reach out‚Äù

‚Äúso I thought I‚Äôd reach out‚Äù

‚Äúso I wanted to reach out‚Äù

Do not use em dashes or endash (‚Äî); use commas or periods instead.

Notes

The icebreaker should feel like it was written by someone genuinely interested in the recipient‚Äôs work.

Avoid generic compliments (e.g., ‚Äúgreat background,‚Äù ‚Äúimpressive experience‚Äù).

Make sure it connects to something specific in the summary (achievement, project, passion).

Relate back to the sender‚Äôs personal interest if possible.

Output must be valid JSON only, with all line breaks as \\n.

Do not include the word ‚ÄúJSON‚Äù in the output.

Example:
{
  "firstName": "Rob",
  "lastName": "Nelson",
  "company": "Rob Nelson Connections LLC",
  "jobTitle": "Co-Founder",
  "summary": "Our team helped 14 brands win Vendor Agreements at AutoZone. They now have 6,900 stores and 112,000 employees. ... I love mentoring and helping others succeed."
}

Example output
{
  "icebreaker":"Hey Rob,\\n\\nSeriously impressed by how you helped 14 brands win AutoZone vendor agreements, it‚Äôs clear you know how to open doors in tough industries so I figured I‚Äôd reach out."
}

Another example:
{ "firstName": "Scott",
  "lastName" : "Montgomery"
"companyName": "CrankTank", 
"title": "CEO, Founder", 
"summary": "I have extensive experience in the outdoor, bike, and wintersports industries. We interact with the CEO/CMO on a host of issues including strategy, marketing with an emphasis on the migration to digital capabilities, sales, and in some cases succession planning. In late 2018, as CEO of Reynolds Cycling, we sold to Hayes Performance, a global leader in the manufacturing and production of bicycle components and other products. } what you will 

output -> { "icebreaker":"Hey Jeff,\\n\\nImpressed by how well the business building in your career has been, with all the startups under your belt very impressed! As someone who also enjoys the freedom of ebikes and where they can take you, I figured I'd connect." }

parameters.body:
={
    "campaign": "[YOUR INSTANTLY CAMPAIGN ID HERE]",
    "email": "{{ $('Append or update row in sheet').item.json.email }}",
    "first_name": "{{ $('Format Names').item.json.message.content.firstName }}",
    "last_name": "{{ $('Format Names').item.json.message.content.lastName }}",
    "company_name": "{{ $('Append or update row in sheet').item.json.company }}",

"skip_if_in_workspace": true,
"skip_if_in_campaign": true,
"skip_if_in_list": true,
"verify_leads_for_lead_finder": true,
"verify_leads_on_import": true,
"custom_variables": {
      "icebreaker": "{{ $json.message.content.icebreaker }}"
    }
}

values.content:
=Chat gpt Model will format names by stripping out unnescessary symbols titles extra period and dashes and punctuation while preserving the core name structure. Model will keep multi part sur names and accented /non latin  characters intact. The output should be a clean, plain english version of the name with the following rules and return firstName and lastName in new variables in JSON Format only:

remove all symbols and emojies(e.g., "-" "." "üìâ" "üòé"). 

Strip out professional titles 
Examples:("founder" "MSc" "interim cmo".) 
Remove punctuation after initials 
Examples:("carl W." becomes "carl W".) 
Preserve multi-part or hyphenated surnames 
Examples: ("Jean-Paul Sartre" remains "Jean-Paul Sartre"). 

Maintain accented or non latin characters (e.g., "major√°n"). 
Examples: ("Kitti Major√°n ,MSc" to "Kitti Major√°n" "Zennor Robinson üåπ" will chance to "Zennor Roinson" "Johnny j Pawlik - Founder,Conference Speaker,Interim CMO üìâ" change into "Johnny Pawlik" "Carl W." to "Carl W")

parameters.content:
## Read Sheets and Filter Variables

This workflow begins with a Google Sheets file that contains your scraped lead data. Checks if it has all the necessary variables to proceed and filters out ones that done. 

Make sure you connect your google sheets API on google cloud console.

## Notify 

When the loop is complete it will send a notification to telegram to notify you that your workflow is complete and you can start using the newly added campaign on instantly.

The Limit node is there because sometimes the "loop over items" node would output as much as it has looped which is problematic. 

Also with Telegram make sure your able to create a seperate chat to receieve these notification there is a link here to create chat bots on the telegram ecosystem. 

https://core.telegram.org/bots/tutorial#obtain-your-bot-token

## Format Names
In this node we focus on cleaning and standardizing the user's first and last name. This step improves the quality of the icebreaker by giving the AI a clean, natural name to work with.

Unformatted names look robotic and unprofessional. For example, you do not want the AI generating an opener like:

‚ÄúHey John E Riley III‚Äù

Proper formatting helps the icebreaker feel more personal and less automated.

## Ice Breaker Generator

Using the person‚Äôs first name, last name, email, bio, summary, and company name, we will generate a personalized icebreaker for cold email outreach or linkedin direct message outreach. and inside the node is the system prompt I use for creating ice breakers Feel free to test differnt prompt for different results of ice breakers.

## Add leads to a campaign

This includes adding all required variables to the campaign. Refer to the documentation for the correct process of adding leads: 
https://developer.instantly.ai/api/v2/lead/bulkaddleads

Provide first name, last name, email, and a description if needed. It‚Äôs important to create the custom variables as shown in the documentation, as this is where the icebreaker variable will be stored in Instantly.

## Creating and populating new sheet within your Google sheet
We are grabbing all the rows that can be useful to us and attaching it to a new sheet within the same google sheet document we previously used this way we can be more organized

## Loop over each name 
that we are pulling from pervious node.

## Goal / Overview

The purpose of this workflow is to extract all the information from a excel sheet or excel any kind of .xlsx file type with rows of information which will contain infromation about leads that you extracted from a particular niche and use A.i to create a personalized icebreaker for a cold email outreach system on instantly and then add their name email and the generated ice breaker on to a Instantly campaign which can be used on a massive email outreach system. 
 
## How It Works
## Collects Data:
Start with a spreadsheet containing detailed lead information. Typical fields include:

First Name
Last Name
Summary or Bio
Company Name
This you would have to obtain on your own or export from a lead scraper. Insure that the information that your scraping is up to date and contains information that the a.i can use to create customized personal ice breaker such as current job title , job history, recent achievements infomation the a.i can create some sort of relatability too. 
## Using A.I to create Ice Breakers
as mentioned we are using Chat gpt to be able use the information from the google sheet to be able to curate a human like ice breaker and in which we will use it on instantly. 

## Pre requisites
Google Sheets APi
Instantly campaign ID
Open A.I API key
(Optional) Telegram to notify you when workflow is complete. 
A very well written system prompt to tell the a.i how to create the ice breaker is key and this comes from trail and error.

main.node: Append or update row in sheet

user.name: Jason Stelo

Check out the link in my Bio to book a consolation call and see how I can help your business.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
